titleStmt.title: Louis H. Pelouze to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12023

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 68th Regiment 1864-1877 Militia Claims and Expenses

body.p:
STATE OF KENTUCKY.
OFFICE QUARTER-MASTER GENERAL,
Frankfort, , 187

A Copy
Washington City
War Department.
May 19' 1864.
Thos. E Bramlette
Gov of Ky.

Sir -- I am instructed by the Secretary of War to acknowledge the receipt of Your Excellencys Communication of the 28' inst. asking if any arrangements can be made for the payment ofby the United States of the 68' Enrolled Militia of Kentucky called out in April last. by Col Gallup Commanding the District of East Kentucky for the purpose of protecting his depots & lines of communication when threatened by the rebels and in reply to state that the Paymaster General has been ordered
to pay these troops for the time they were actually in service.

Very respectfully.
Louis H. Pelouze.
Asst Adjt Genl

Order
To pay 68' Militia.
original sent to Washington.
Mch 31st 1871
